meanings.definition: Invite (someone) before others or before the usual time.
meanings.sent1: I will preinvite my best friend to the party so she can come early.
meanings.sent2: It is polite to preinvite guests to events to ensure they can attend.
meanings.sent3: The eager host decided to preinvite the entire neighborhood to the barbecue.
meanings.sent4: She preinvited him to the movie night, knowing he would appreciate the gesture.
meanings.sent5: To preinvite is to show consideration and thoughtfulness towards your guests.

meanings.definition: An invitation extended before others or before the usual time.
meanings.sent1: The preinvite for the wedding arrived in a beautiful envelope.
meanings.sent2: Receiving a preinvite to the exclusive event made her feel special.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would only attend if he received a preinvite.
meanings.sent4: The preinvite was like a golden ticket to the highly anticipated concert.
meanings.sent5: The preinvite set the tone for an exciting and memorable gathering.
